intro: Discolobium junceum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf discolobium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in heathland and woodland habitats. It features small, narrow leaves and produces yellow or pale green flowers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
